psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 97,1]]The LORD is king; let the earth rejoice; 
let the many islands be glad.
[[Ps 97,2]]Clouds and darkness are round about him, 
justice and judgment are the foundation of his throne.

[[Ps 97,5]]The mountains melt like wax before the LORD, 
before the Lord of all the earth.
[[Ps 97,6]]The heavens proclaim his justice, 
and all peoples see his glory.

[[Ps 97,11]]Light dawns for the just; 
And gladness, for the upright of heart.
[[Ps 97,12]]Be glad in the LORD, you just, 
And give thanks to his holy name.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
gospel.text:
[[Lc 11,27]]While Jesus was speaking, a woman from the crowd called out and said to him, "Blessed is the womb that carried you and the breasts at which you nursed."
[[Lc 11,28]]He replied, "Rather, blessed are those who hear the word of God and observe it."

first_reading.title: Book of Joel
first_reading.text:
[[Jl 4,12]]Thus says the LORD: Let the nations bestir themselves and come up to the Valley of Jehoshaphat; For there will I sit in judgment upon all the neighboring nations.
[[Jl 4,13]]Apply the sickle, for the harvest is ripe; Come and tread, for the wine press is full; The vats overflow, for great is their malice.
[[Jl 4,14]]Crowd upon crowd in the valley of decision; For near is the day of the LORD in the valley of decision.
[[Jl 4,15]]Sun and moon are darkened, and the stars withhold their brightness.
[[Jl 4,16]]The LORD roars from Zion, and from Jerusalem raises his voice; The heavens and the earth quake, but the LORD is a refuge to his people, a stronghold to the men of Israel.
[[Jl 4,17]]Then shall you know that I, the LORD, am your God, dwelling on Zion, my holy mountain; Jerusalem shall be holy, and strangers shall pass through her no more.
[[Jl 4,18]]And then, on that day, the mountains shall drip new wine, and the hills shall flow with milk; And the channels of Judah shall flow with water: A fountain shall issue from the house of the LORD, to water the Valley of Shittim.
[[Jl 4,19]]Egypt shall be a waste, and Edom a desert waste, Because of violence done to the people of Judah, because they shed innocent blood in their land.
[[Jl 4,20]]But Judah shall abide forever, and Jerusalem for all generations.
[[Jl 4,21]]I will avenge their blood, and not leave it unpunished. The LORD dwells in Zion.
